com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.test.example

Class ExampleSeleniumTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.test.selenium.WComponentSeleniumTestCase
      • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.test.example.ExampleSeleniumTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExampleMultiBrowserSeleniumTest

    public class ExampleSeleniumTest
extends WComponentSeleniumTestCase

    This class is an example showing various ways of testing a WComponent UI using Selenium. The same UI is tested multiple times using different approaches.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Yiannis Paschalidis

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExampleSeleniumTest

        public ExampleSeleniumTest()
        Creates a ExampleSeleniumTest. The WComponent which is passed to the superclass's constructor is the UI to be tested. Small sections of application code may need to be wrapped in a shell which puts them in the correct state.

    • Method Detail

      • testDuplicatorWithNoGettersWComponentPathImpl

        public void testDuplicatorWithNoGettersWComponentPathImpl()
        This test implementation uses ByWComponentPath to find the HTML controls. A ByWComponentPath is built using a full or partial set of classes which describe a path through the WComponent Tree structure. This is the preferred method of testing WComponent UIs, as it should be stable between releases, and does not require applications to expose UI structure via getters. The UI structure tree structure used in this example is as follows: 
            ExampleUI
       WTabSet
          WTab
            TextDuplicator
              WTextField
              WButton
              WButton
          WTab
            TextDuplicatorWithGetters
              WTextField
              WButton
              WButton
        So to obtain the first WTextField, any of the following paths could be used:
        Full path, including tab index
        ExampleUI/WTabSet/WTab[0]/ExampleSeleniumTest$TextDuplicator/WTextField
        Full path, minus tab index (first tab is used)
        ExampleUI/WTabSet/WTab/ExampleSeleniumTest$TextDuplicator/WTextField
        First text field in a TextDuplicator
        ExampleSeleniumTest$TextDuplicator/WTextField
        First text field in the first tab
        WTab/WTextField
        First text field in the whole UI
        WTextField
        The amount of detail you will need to specify for the paths in your tests will depend on how your UI is structured. If you have created reusable application components (e.g. a "NamePanel"), you will be able to match on this directly in the path rather than having to look for the WComponent[x]/WComponent[y]/WComponent[z].

      • testDuplicatorWithNoGettersHtmlImpl

        public void testDuplicatorWithNoGettersHtmlImpl()
        This test implementation uses a 'traditional' Selenium approach, matching on HTML elements. This method should not generally be used for testing WComponent applications, as the HTML output can change without notice between different theme versions; the rendered HTML is transform-dependant, not WComponent-dependant.

      • testDuplicatorWithGettersWComponentPathImpl

        public void testDuplicatorWithGettersWComponentPathImpl()
        This test implementation uses ByWComponentPath to find the HTML controls. See testDuplicatorWithNoGettersWComponentPathImpl() for an explanation of how the paths function.

      • testDuplicatorWithGettersWComponentImpl

        public void testDuplicatorWithGettersWComponentImpl()
        This test implementation uses ByWComponent to find the HTML controls. This is the easiest approach to use, but requires that the UI being tested has been built with getters for every control, which is not usually practical.
